hypothesis_content.title: Structural Liquidity Shift to Perp-Derivatives Ratio
hypothesis_content.statement: The October 'liquidity crash' has permanently altered market structure, increasing the predictive power of the Perpetual Swap Funding Rate to Spot Volume ratio. When this ratio exceeds 2.0 standard deviations above its 30-day mean during NEUTRAL regimes, it predicts 80% probability of a 4-day mean reversion in spot prices.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Post-October, the market has fewer liquidity providers. Extreme funding relative to spot volume now indicates over-leveraged speculative positioning that cannot be sustained in a thinner market, forcing quicker unwinds.
entry_conditions: (Aggregate Perp Funding Rate / Spot Volume) > 30-day mean + (2.0 * 30-day std)
BTC price within +/- 8% of 20-day moving average

exit_conditions.take_profit: Spot price reverts to 20-day moving average +/- 1%
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Funding/Volume ratio increases further to >2.5 std above mean

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If high funding/volume ratios persist >3 days without spot price mean reversion, indicating new structural support for leverage.
